Head of Property Management Job at Paragone Signature & Associates




        
    

        
        Paragone Signature & Associates is a real estate brokerage & property management firm positioned to understanding the specific needs of our clients to fashion the right choice of offering. We operate both within the residential and commercial market - helping clients to either buy, sell, rent and manage properties and further give them well-varied options for their choosing.

We are set to redefine the narrative within the real estate market fostering communal relationships among visitors and traders as well provide clarity to realtors and knowledge seekers. This yields a deeper sense of fulfilment for the next generation of real estate executives

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Head of Property Management

Job Location: Lagos

About the Role


	We are on a bold journey to reshape the future of real estate, and we are looking for visionary leaders to join us at the top.
	As part of our executive team, you will not just manage a role—you will own a stake in building the future of the company.
	This is a rare opportunity to step into a leadership position where your expertise, creativity, and drive directly translate into long-term growth, ownership, and lasting impact.


Requirements
We are looking for dynamic leaders who are:


	Experienced in their field (Property Management or Real Estate Development)
	Strategic thinkers with proven leadership skills
	Passionate about creating innovative solutions in real estate
	Ready to grow with us and take ownership in the success we’re building.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.paragonesignature@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Maurice Xandra Solutions Limited -&nbsp;Our client, a Manufacturing Company, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Human Resources &amp; Administrative Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Reports To: Managing Director / Head of Operations &nbsp;
Industry: Manufacturing / Services

Job Summary


	Our Client is seeking a highly organized and experienced HR &amp; Administrative Manager to oversee all aspects of human resources practices and administrative operations.
	The ideal candidate will provide strategic HR leadership while ensuring efficient administrative support that aligns with the organization&rsquo;s goals and culture.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources:


	Lead and manage end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and orientation processes.
	Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and procedures aligned with business objectives.
	Manage performance management systems and staff appraisal processes.
	Oversee employee relations, grievance handling, and disciplinary procedures.
	Monitor and ensure compliance with labor laws and HR best practices.
	Drive training, development, and capacity-building initiatives.
	?Maintain and update employee records, HR reports, and payroll support documentation.


Administration:


	Manage general office administration, facility management, and procurement processes.
	Supervise support staff (cleaners, drivers, security, etc.) to ensure smooth operations.
	Oversee company assets, logistics, and vendor relationships.
	Maintain effective filing systems and ensure confidentiality of sensitive information.
	Coordinate company meetings, events, and internal communications.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5&ndash;7 years of relevant experience, with at least 2 years in a managerial role.
	Professional certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, HRCI) is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws, HR practices, and payroll systems.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills.
	Proficient in MS Office and HR software/tools (e.g., BambooHR, HRIS systems).
	High level of integrity, discretion, and professionalism.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@mauricexandra.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Human Resources & Administrative Manager Job at Maurice Xandra Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Maurice Xandra Solutions Limited - Our client, a Manufacturing Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources & Administrative Manager

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Reports To: Managing Director / Head of Operations  
Industry: Manufacturing / Services

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Our Client is seeking a highly organized and experienced HR & Administrative Manager to oversee all aspects of human resources practices and administrative operations.
	The ideal candidate will provide strategic HR leadership while ensuring efficient administrative support that aligns with the organization’s goals and culture.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources:


	Lead and manage end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and orientation processes.
	Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and procedures aligned with business objectives.
	Manage performance management systems and staff appraisal processes.
	Oversee employee relations, grievance handling, and disciplinary procedures.
	Monitor and ensure compliance with labor laws and HR best practices.
	Drive training, development, and capacity-building initiatives.
	?Maintain and update employee records, HR reports, and payroll support documentation.


Administration:


	Manage general office administration, facility management, and procurement processes.
	Supervise support staff (cleaners, drivers, security, etc.) to ensure smooth operations.
	Oversee company assets, logistics, and vendor relationships.
	Maintain effective filing systems and ensure confidentiality of sensitive information.
	Coordinate company meetings, events, and internal communications.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5–7 years of relevant experience, with at least 2 years in a managerial role.
	Professional certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, HRCI) is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws, HR practices, and payroll systems.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills.
	Proficient in MS Office and HR software/tools (e.g., BambooHR, HRIS systems).
	High level of integrity, discretion, and professionalism.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@mauricexandra.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
